Package uno.anahata.asi.model.core

Class AbstractToolMessage<T extends AbstractModelMessage>

java.lang.Object
uno.anahata.asi.model.core.AbstractMessage
uno.anahata.asi.model.core.AbstractToolMessage<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyChangeSource
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeminiToolMessage
public abstract class AbstractToolMessage<T extends AbstractModelMessage> extends AbstractMessage
Represents a message containing the results of tool executions. This message is sent from the client back to the model after function calls. It holds a direct reference to the AbstractModelMessage that initiated the tool calls.
Author:
anahata-gemini-pro-2.5

      public Role getRole()
      Description copied from class: AbstractMessage
      Gets the role of the entity that created this message. This is implemented by subclasses to provide compile-time type safety.
      Specified by:

      Returns:
      The role of the message creator.

    • getToolResponses

      public List<AbstractToolResponse<?>> getToolResponses()
      Filters and returns only the tool response parts from this message.
      Returns:
      A list of AbstractToolResponse parts, or an empty list if none exist.

    • isAutoRunnable

      public boolean isAutoRunnable()
      Determines if this entire batch of tool calls can be executed automatically without user intervention.
      Returns:
      true if all conditions for automatic execution are met.

    • hasApprovedPendingTools

      public boolean hasApprovedPendingTools()
      Checks if there are any tool responses in a PENDING state that have the APPROVE_ALWAYS permission.
      Returns:
      true if at least one approved tool is pending.

    • executeAllPending

      public void executeAllPending()
      Executes all tool responses in this message that are currently in a PENDING state.

    • processPendingTools

      public void processPendingTools()
      Processes all tool responses in this message that are currently in a PENDING state. Tools with APPROVE_ALWAYS permission are executed, while others are rolled to NOT_EXECUTED. This method also updates the chat status if any tools are executed.
